sections.title: Overview
sections.content: A smart pill dispenser built using an STM32 microcontroller. The system helps patients take the correct medicine at the correct time and reduces mistakes caused by forgetting or taking double doses. It is designed for both hospital and home-care use.

sections.title: Problem
sections.content: Many patients, especially elderly users, forget to take medicine or take it more than once. In hospitals, staff are busy and manual medicine handling can lead to mistakes.

sections.title: Goals
items: Help patients follow their medicine schedule.

sections.title: Solution
sections.content: The system automatically releases pills at scheduled times. It uses sensors to confirm dispensing and RFID to control access. This reduces human error and improves reliability.

sections.title: System Modes
items: Normal mode for daily medicine dispensing.
Setup mode for staff to change settings using RFID.

sections.title: How It Works
items: User or staff sets the medicine schedule.
At the scheduled time, the servo rotates to release one pill.
IR sensor checks if a pill is released.
RFID allows staff to enter setup mode.
Display shows time, status, and instructions.
